headline: Absolutely the Best Chocolate Chip Cookies
description: These chocolate chip cookies are chewy, crisp, and simple to make with basic pantry staples and Mexican vanilla extract for a spicy, creamy flavor.

video.description: Try these addictive cookies, featuring milk-chocolate chips. Mmm.
video.name: Absolutely the Best Chocolate Chip Cookies

name: Absolutely the Best Chocolate Chip Cookies

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease 2 cookie sheets.
Cream together butter-flavored shortening, brown sugar, and white sugar in a large bowl until light and fluffy. Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition; stir in vanilla.
Combine flour, baking soda, and salt in a separate bowl; gradually stir into creamed mixture.
Fold in chocolate chips until well combined.
Drop by rounded spoonfuls onto the prepared cookie sheets.
Bake in the preheated oven until light brown, 8 to 10 minutes. Allow cookies to cool on the baking sheet for 5 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.

review.reviewBody: They're good but my oven might be too cool because ten minutes was too short a time. Second and third sheets were better for me. Good and quick cookie though. I'll make them again.

These are tasty and easy cookies to make. I've made some substitutions to accommodate dietary requirements. I used butter instead of margarine, SweetLeaf Better than Sugar granuals to replace the white sugar and SweetLeaf Brown Better than Sugar granuals, sugar free chocolate chips and homemade vanilla. These changes have not taken away from the taste of these great cookies
All I can say is people raved! They did not hang around long at all lol. I am now baking these on a regular basis because I get many requests for them …you can’t go wrong!

Great recipe! I always add extra vanilla extract though and I don't have butter flavored crisco so I just added some butter extract. I also added about a half tsp of baking powder and they turned out amazing. People were coming back for seconds and thirds.
I have been making these for the last 45 years! Everyone loves them and ask for the recipe! These are my favorites to give at Christmas! Highly recommend!! Can't go wrong.

I think the trick for success is using parchment paper on the baking sheets. My cookies kept a nice shape and didn’t spread too thin. I will keep this recipe in my favorites.

I m a new to baking so did lot of worst baking.. Then began to learn about baking science... Spended 1 week to learn about chocochip cookies science.. Dis s d best recipe.. Use 1/2 cup cake flour and 1/2 cup bread flour and no baking soda, it makes cookies flat.. Use baking powder.. 1 tsp..

My go-to recipe! I always use a little bit less salt, use real butter instead of the flavoured shortening, and make them small so there's more to go around. They always disappear within hours of baking!

This recipe is what I have been looking for for years! Nice chunky thick cookies with great flavor. This will be my go to recipe forever.

These really are the best!!! I used half butter flavored shortening and one stick of butter. I also used semi sweet chocolate chips and a cup of chocolate chunk pieces. They are so moist!!! Just melt in your mouth good... Will use this recipe again and again!

I usually struggle with Chocolate chip cookies, but these Turned out great. Doubled recipe (i recommend). Used regular sheet pans (special air flow one made them flat) and only cooked 1 pan at a time (verically) in oven, on top rack, farthest from heat source. Use Medium pampered chef scoop to portion, 8 cookies to a pan, flatten slightly after scooping. Most beautiful cookies I've made. Since I am gluten free, I don't have a review on taste. I made these for family and friends. Will update in future when i get their response!

I am not a fan of chocolate chip cookies but these cookies I LOVE! They are truly the best and so easy to make. I use Country Crock baking sticks and Trader Joe's chocolate chunks and they come out perfect every time. Thank you thank you thank you for posting this recipe.

Amazing cookies! Chewy centre and slightly crispy exterior. No flattening at all. To avoid getting flattened cookies: make sure to really beat the shortening (or butter if you’ve substituted), sugar, egg mixture until it turns very light beige and is light and fluffy (took 2-3 min of beating at medium speed with electric mixer after adding each egg to get this result). I made a batch with shortening and one with butter: very similar results, FYI in case you only have butter on hand.

These were good but not great. The first batch came out to mushy and spred way too much. The first thing you need to tell people is are you scooping out the flour or dipping in thus makeing it more compact? After that what I did to fix it is instead of adding more flour I added cocoa powder to make theme cho. choc. chip. These came out fantastick. So If you want to keep them plain dip into the flour bag if not then scoop and add 3/4c. cocoa to the flour mixture. I also upped the vanilla by a bit for more flavor.

Edit..... I've made these about 20 times since and have them down pat. First off, add another tbsp. of flour. Second, add 1/2 tsp. butter flavoring if not using butter flavored shortening. Third, add another 1/2 tsp. Vanilla and up the brown sugar (dark) to 1 cup and white sugar decreased to 1/2 cup then they are perfect. Allow the dough to rest overnight in the refrigerator if possible to get the best flavor.

Only changes were 1/4 tsp cream of tartar, used super dark brown sugar, and used dark chocolate disks with extra disks stuck into the dough tops before baking. Will make these again and again.
These are absolutely the best chocolate chip cookies ever. Thanks for sharing.

I make them all the time but since I live at a high altitude, over 4000 ft, I have to add extra flour so they don't go flat. I use 3 cups of flour and they come out perfect.

My son requested chocolate chip cookies with "no nuts, and with milk chocolate chips", so I gave these a try. I didn't have butter flavored shortening, so I used half Crisco/half real butter. While mine didn't turn out as pretty as the ones in the picture (mine spread out quite a bit), they were still tasty. I only made half a batch, as these are just for my son's lunches. He likes them, so that's what counts.
